pros: awesome place to do research
cons: nothing to tell about cons

pros: Circa 750 Euros per month from tutorship. 3,000 Euros after tax and insurances. Relatively cheap living cost compared to large cities.
cons: Work environment differs by supervisors, research chairs, and subjects. A little bit rural area, depending on perspective. In Germany, you are not accepted well as a English speaker.

pros: Freedom to pursue intellectually challenging goals
cons: Not the most attractive location

pros: Good opportunity to gain an experience while studying.
cons: Allows to get scientific experience only.

pros: Great University to persue study
cons: no cons is all good

pros: Very good scientific instruments less student fee good food
cons: Outside main city, Language problem for international students

pros: The salary is public so no need to negotiate
cons: No stability, only short term contracts.

pros: freedom, good salary, calm place
cons: boring, static, hard to get novelty

pros: Friendly, independent work and lively
cons: Less support from fellow employees

pros: No tolerance for poor quality work.
cons: Employees here lack social life balance.

pros: Saarbr[cken is a small city with low prices for rent and food. So this salary is a good salary.
cons: I do not have any cons.

pros: great working culture, organized administration
cons: none, perhaps location is not the best

pros: Good infrastructure and campus ecosystem.
cons: Limited term contracts. Rigid tarif net.

pros: good salaries, flexible working hours
cons: Not much to say about this

pros:
- Good experience
- Very good for computer science. Offer a lot of courses.
- Faculty is excellent. Experts in their field.
cons:
- Saarbrucken is a cheap place but it is not the most lively city.
- Student housing could be better. Since student housing is cheaper, student prefer to get a place there but it is difficult to find a place in one of the dorms.

job_title: University Postdoctoral Fellow in Homburg, Saarland
pros: Good working environmemnt, resource availability.
cons: Has some ground to cover to become a more compatitive university.

pros: I enjoy working on Saarland University campus with great colleagues!
cons: Working at a university can sometimes involve lengthy bureaucratic processes.

pros: it was a very friendly working environment
cons: it was a nice working environment

pros: Very Chill place to be
cons: Gotta be careful with the contracts

pros:
Research Experience
Thesis Opportunities
Flexible Work Hours
cons: Salary in Start Ups is higher

review_title: Experience of two years in a rather small team (~10 people)
pros: At Saarland University I could experience versatile projects on very interesting an challenging contexts. I had the opportunity to be a teaching assistant and work with various international collaborators.
cons: My work here was sometimes very demanding (problem of working in academic research) and I could feel very isolated from the team from time to time. The latter inconvenient is team-dependent obviously.

pros: Good pay for academics compared to other univs
cons: Not open or friendly to English speaking/non-european students

pros: If you like being surrounded by friendly locals, you will love it
cons: if you want stability and an office that is not falling apart, this might not be for you

pros: Share knowledge while improving myself
cons: Too much workload compared to salary

review_title: Wasting your time at an unpleasant and unprofessional place to work. Generally not recommendable.
pros:
* Easy work 
* Good Work / Life balance 
* You are given much freedom to do your work the way you like
* You get to work in a quiet environment
* Wages are being paid promptly
* Technical equipment (PCs, servers, etc) is modern and usable
cons:
* Complete lack of structured work organisation
* Incompetent co-workers without much domain knowledge needed for the job
* Incompetent managers without any domain knowledge needed for the job
* Little respect shown for you work
* Endless tele-conferences
* Endles back-and-forth on mailing list
* General indecisiveness
* They don't want you to take part in social activities if you're "only" an assistant
* Projects fail all the time

pros: You get to work on a topic that you are interested in. You get a lot of freedom in pursuing your goals. If you work hard, you get to travel a lot. There are lots of interesting talks by internation scholars. The ambitious people around you are motivating and stimulating.
cons: You have to be able to work independently. Do not expect to be supported on small steps. Finding your own topic may be hard. Early on, there might be quite a lot of teaching work to do. If you are not too successful, it might be quite dispiriting with lots of bright people around.

review_title: Post doctoral researcher in Pharmaceutical and Medicinal Chemistry
pros: New building and laboratories, very nice office with a lot of windows. Very good laboratory equipment. Nice co-workers with a big know-how. Nice break room.
cons: Not much. Because outside are some construction work sometimes a little bit loud. Sometime the automatic door is not working properly.

review_title: Wissenschaftlicher Mitarbeiter at Universität des Saarlandes
pros: Very good research conditions, a good opportunity to develop in this area and a very challenging work atmosphere at the pharmaceutical and medicinal chemistry department
cons: General discontent with the management because of poor field knowledge and very poor project management skills, especially regarding staff motivation

pros:
Great environment
Very friendly co-workers
Can work nearly form anywhere
Great way to earn a bit of money while studying
cons: Lots of different possible jobs as a research assistant. How great the job is in the end, depends largely on what job exactly one does.

pros: Good neuroscience center in a new building that is aiming for collaborative work through different professors working on different branches in neuroscience.
cons: Short contracts and career instability as not much permanent positions available. The publishing rate is not that fast too.

review_title: Saaland University is an excellent research center in the field of Computer Science.
pros:
1. State of the art infrastructure.
2. Opportunities to work on highly innovative projects.
cons: 1. Nothing to mention during my period of study.

pros: good research facility, sufficient funding from DFG (German research council)
cons:
the city Saarbrucken is a little bit boring, too much politics and administration
permanent employees like secretary, technicians does work efficiently

pros:
- Ideal environment to concentrate on your work.
- Amazing computer science faculty
- All the administrative tasks are done quickly
- Very friendly atmosphere
cons: - Only location in Saarbrucken

pros: Quite good work conditions for PhD student (contract with health insurance, not fellowship)
cons: Salary accordingly to part-time, however it is expected to work as for full-time

pros:
Nice atmosphere. 
Near to University campus. 
Friendly colleagues in the Chair.
cons: Not much work to move around.

pros: state of the art research, flexible hours, relatively decent salary, good collegaues, nice office
cons: too hot office, toilets not nice

review_title: Computer science department at Saarland University
pros: Apt mix of mathematics and applications.
cons: Small city when compared to other German cities.

pros: Research oriented jobs, learn new state of the art technologies
cons: studies and work balance bit difficult, less industry exposure

pros: International environment and a good place to work.
cons: no. Cons :) in my opinion.

pros: Excellent academic diversity on campus.
cons: Only temporary employment (four years)
